explanation: Tesla reports its first quarterly profit 11 million. This was the biggest one-day jump in TSLA stock
short_description: First quarterly profit since the company went public

explanation: Musk settled the charges with the SEC, agreeing to pay a civil penalty of $20 million and give up his role as chairman of the board for at least three years
short_description: 'Taking private' tweet charges settled with SEC

explanation: Reports that the Model S was cleared of any defect by the German Federal Motor Transport Authority after three crashes involving the car ended in fires
short_description: Model S cleared of defects after crashes involving fire

explanation: Second quarter earnings report, less-than-expected cash burn, CEO Elon Musk's apologies for his attitude in a previous earnings call
Deliveries of Model S in the fourth quarter blew past what the company had forecast
Underwhelming third-quarter results, news of third Model S fire
short_description: Poor 3rd quarter, third Model S fire

explanation: Goldman analyst Patrick Archambault put out a report with a price target on the stock of $84, a 34 percent discount to the prior day close of $127.26.
short_description: Goldman Sachs undervalues Tesla stock price

explanation: More than six weeks after Musk tweeted 'funding secured', the SEC sued the Tesla CEO for issuing “false and misleading” statements and for failing to properly notify regulators of material company events.
short_description: SEC sues Elon Musk for 'funding secured' tweet

explanation: Reported a wider-than-expected loss, disappointing revenue and announced the departure of co-founder and CTO JB Straubel from the executive ranks.
The announcement of an ~7% job cut along with Musk’s warnings about challenges and rising competition
short_description: Announcement of 7% job cut, rising competition

explanation: Elon Musk tweets suggesting that he was considering taking Tesla private at $420 a share — which was a 20% premium to the company’s stock price at the time

Musk suggested that a British cave diver who was part a team that rescued a Thai soccer team from a cave was a pedophile. Musk made the remark after the diver, Vern Unsworth, dismissed Musk's offer to send a mini-submarine to help with rescue efforts as a 'PR stunt'

Musk committed an epic Twitter gaffe when he projected Tesla's full-year 2019 manufacturing numbers at 5,00,000. The production projection immediately sent the media into overdrive because the estimate was much higher than expected. Hours later, Musk clarified his original tweet, saying he 'meant to say' the company's annualized production rate at the end of 2019 could reach 500,000 vehicles
As Tesla struggles to ramp up Model 3 production and blows deadlines, Musk issues an April Fools’ tweet declaring his automaker 'bankrupt'
After a Tesla in Autopilot mode hit a stopped fire truck, Musk defended the sorta-self-driving system and criticized the media for covering it
short_description: Tweet criticising media coverage of Autopilot accidents

explanation: At an earnings call, during an exchange between an analyst and Tesla’s CFO, about capital expenditures, Musk interrupted suddenly 'Excuse me, next. Boring, bonehead questions are not cool. Next?'
Elon Musk appeared to smoke marijuana during an interview streamed on the web
